name: Rhea
description:
Rhea (*REE-ə*; Ancient Greek: Ῥέᾱ) is the second-largest moon of Saturn and the ninth-largest moon in the Solar System. It is the second smallest body in the Solar System, after the asteroid and dwarf planet Ceres, for which precise measurements have confirmed a shape consistent with hydrostatic equilibrium. It was discovered in 1672 by Giovanni Domenico Cassini.

Excerpt via [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhea_(moon)).
